original: DREYFUS, Ludwig Arthur, Doktoringenjör, Västerås, f King Williams Town, Sydafrika, 22/10 85 av grosshandl Th Dreyfus o Clara Levison, gm Inez Renborg. Mog.ex v lärov 1 Munchen 04, dipl.ing Techn Hochschule, Munchen, avd M 08, avd E 09, dr.ing där 09. Anst AEG, Berlin, 09—15, därav ss provrums-ing 09—11, chef f maskinlab 11—13 o chef f provrummet 13—15, chef f Högsp.lab ASEA, Ludvika, 19—21, chef f ASEA:s laboratorier 21—30, chef f ASEA:s tillv.avd :s konsult.byrå sed. 30. IVA:s mindre GM, CedergrensM. Avtrycket: Talr upps o skrifter liuviidsakl inom elmaskinområdet, däribl sådana som avsett genomslag hos fasta isolermaterial, fördeln av den elstatiska påkänningen kring lindningar o konstr.delar, kommuteringsteorin m särsk hänsyn t svagströmsstörn, kaskadkoppl maskinaggregat samt konstr av tågbelysnings -o bågsvetsningsaggregat. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: DREYFUS, Ludwig Arthur, Doctor Engineer, Västerås, f King William's Town, South Africa, 22/10 85, son of merchant Th Dreyfus and Clara Levison, married to Inez Renborg. Formerly student at a secondary school in Munich in 1904, graduated from the Technical University of Munich, Department M in 1908, Department E in 1909, earned his Doctorate degree in Engineering there in 1909. Employed at AEG, Berlin, 1909-1915, initially as a testing engineer from 1909 to 1911, then as the head of the machine lab from 1911 to 1913, and finally as the head of the testing department from 1913 to 1915. Chief of the High Voltage Laboratory at ASEA, Ludvika, 1919-1921, head of ASEA's laboratories from 1921 to 1930, and chief of ASEA's manufacturing department's consulting agency since 1930. A member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences, Cedergrens Minde. Known for contributions in the field of electrical machinery, including research on insulation materials, distribution of electrostatic stress around windings and structural components, commutation theory with specific focus on low voltage disturbance, cascaded machine units, and the design of lighting and arc welding equipment for trains. Led Swedish Technical Association.
